data.title: People — Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine
data.text:
Reba Askari is Theatre Artistic Director of Maddy’s Theatre at the Children’s Museum & Theatre of Maine and a proud native of Boothbay Harbor, Maine. She majored in Theatre Arts and minored in Women’s Studies at Mount Holyoke College and holds a Masters in Theatre Education from Emerson College. Reba served as a Youth Development Peace Corps Volunteer in Morocco. Reba is currently a company member of Mad Horse Theatre Ensemble, and has worked at CMTM since the organizational merger in 2008. Reba has spent the past decade creating children’s theatre by kids for kids, harnessing the power of the dramatic arts as a powerful teaching tool.

Email Reba

Carnegie Mellon University, M.S., H. John Heinz III College, Concentration in Public Policy and Management & American University, B.A. in Communications

Julie has led the organization since July 2019 and together with her colleagues, navigated the COVID-19 pandemic as well as a move to a brand new facility over the course of 2020 and 2021. Prior to joining CMTM, she served as Executive Director of Grow Pittsburgh in Pittsburgh, PA, where she worked alongside city and regional policy makers, leaders of underserved communities, as well as funders to increase access to green space and implement healthy food programs for children and families. Julie currently serves as the Vice President of the Board of Directors at Full Plates, Full Potential. She lives in Portland with her husband, two children and two dogs. When not at work, Julie enjoys sailing, skiing and anything connected to the outdoors and spending time with her family.

Email Julie

Emily Dixon is the Theatre Production Manager at the Children’s Museum & Theatre of Maine. Emily holds a degree in Theater & Dance from Keene State College. She served as the Technical Director at Vermont Academy in Saxtons River, VT the stage manager at MoCo Arts in Keene, NH, and the assistant camp director of MoCo's CAKE Summer Arts Camp. Emily loves watching kids make discoveries about themselves and their place in the world as they develop lifelong skills through theater.

Email Emily

Lily O’Brien Gilbert is the Director of Visitor Engagement at the Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine. Lily earned a BA in Art History with a French Minor from Skidmore College. She previously taught in a one-room schoolhouse, managed floor staff at a children's museum in Eastern Tennessee and led an art and social justice camp in Transylvania, Romania. She also started a sewing and education initiative to help villagers in Eastern Europe collaboratively move from a subsistence economy to a market economy. Lily is a Girl Scout Troop leader and a member of the Junior League of Portland. When Lily is not at the Museum & Theatre, she is most likely riding her horses, Buster and Pilgrim.

Email Lily

Lauren Grant is an Education Program Associate at the Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine. Lauren holds a BFA in Painting with an Art History minor from the Maine College of Art & Design. As a Maine native, she loves to support and spread positivity within her Maine community! She has a passion for education that stems from her desire to spread her love of art and creativity.

Email Lauren

Starr grew up in Portland, Maine and is a citizen of Kitigan Zibi Anishinabeg, an Algonquin community in Quebec. Previously, Starr worked at the Abbe Museum for 5 years as the Curator of Education where she led her department to create collaborative frameworks for decolonizing education, interdisciplinary curriculum, and community-centered exhibits that prioritized Wabanaki voices and perspectives. She is passionate about transforming museums into accessible, equitable, and welcoming sites of community building and storytelling. She is a board member and treasurer for Maine Archives and Museum where she advocates for cultural institutions throughout the state. Starr has a background in classroom education and earned her Masters of Teaching from Colgate University where she also received her B.A. in Native American Studies.

Email Starr

MacKenzie has been a part of the arts since she could walk. From taking ballet classes and being a part of every childrens theatre production she could, to teaching, managing, and operating non-profit organizations. She is passionate about creating safe spaces for children to feel creative and explore, and giving that opportunity to everyone. MacKenzie spent her early adulthood traveling and finding any form of artistic expression she could, and has spent most of her professional career aiding in management and development of non-profits arts organizations. MacKenzie now resides in Cape Elizabeth with her Daughter, cat, and dog named Miller. In her free time she enjoys photography, hiking, and spending time with her family.

Email MacKenzie

Brittany Liscord is the Education Program Manager at the Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine. She earned a BA in English and History from Allegheny College and a MA in Museum Studies from Johns Hopkins. She previously worked in museum education at Strawbery Banke Museum in Portsmouth, NH, and Canterbury Shaker Village in Canterbury, NH. Brittany brings a love for exploring the world through drama, scientific observation, cooking, and play. She spends her free time nature walking, beach-going, and bakery-frequently in South Portland with her husband, young son, and dog.

Email Brittany

Read about Brittany on our News Blog.

Allison holds a BA in Theatre and Art History from Muhlenberg College and studied Theatre/Performance Studies at Goldsmiths, University of London. Her theatrical training includes Commedia dell'Arte, Shakespeare & classical verse, Boal Forum Theatre/Theatre of the Oppressed, Playmaking & New Play Development, and perhaps any type of puppetry you can imagine. She has been a proud member of Mad Horse Theatre Company since 2015 and currently serves on the MHTC Directorial Leadership Team. Allison works as a professional actor around New England, and when not in a theatre, she can usually be found climbing mountains.

Email Allison

Read about Allison on our News Blog.

Jamie Shaw is the Finance & HR Manager at the Children's Museum & Theatre of Maine. A jill-of-all-trades, she brings an array of diverse experiences with years as a bookkeeper, journalist and photographer, and a variety of hands-on and leadership roles in the manufacturing, construction, and service industries. Jamie grew up in the midcoast, and spends her free time looking for good stories and pursuing creative interests such as drawing and painting, sculpting, writing, and woodworking.

Email Jamie

BA Psychology, Dickinson College (Carlisle, PA)

Lucia has a BA in Psychology with a focus on child development and has worked with children and parents for many years. Prior to joining the CMTM team, she taught pre-kindergarten and spent her summers teaching environmental education with Maine youth at Tanglewood 4-H Learning Center. Working with the Museum & Theatre over the past decade, she has spearheaded strategic planning initiatives, led many successful non-profit partnerships, and worked to ensure children, families and community organizations have diverse and developmentally appropriate experiences through play.

Email Lucia
